title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: June 6
body:
Hi folks,
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get put delayed or even stopped. If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
**Post-Midseason stability**

Now that all the midseason changes, bar the couple of new fighter items, are out, we're going to focusing mainly on polish and stability until preseason. We've made quite a lot of changes recently and want to pair that with a period of low systemic change. That will mean patches being more just balance adjustments, and less major overhauls of anything. That's something we aim for each year after midseason, as we hit the second half of the ranked season and the run up to Worlds. Looking at the amount of change we've made this year though, and the style in which it's come out, it feels extra important to do. 

In particular, spreading midseason changes out over a few patches was more disruptive than we'd anticipated. We were hoping to minimize the shake up of any individual patch and keep things steadier since we'd have time to react to each set of changes separately. In retrospect though the outcome was more a period of constant readjustment than greater stability. We'll be aiming to cluster changes back in a single patch more in the future as a result.  

----------------------------------------------------------------------------  
**Systemic change we will still be looking at**

We will still be doing some work to pull back early snowball, as mentioned last week. Even though we're looking for a period of stability we think that's important enough that it needs to be done regardless. The systemic changes already in 8.12 (2 new fighter items plus nerfs to Heal/Shield items and some gifted shield durations) are still planned as well. Beyond that things should be fairly light until November. It's also likely preseason's more focused this year on improving various existing parts of the game than adding new elements, though we've yet to plan preseason out in full detail.

Good afternoon Meddler, I hope this day finds you well. 

I realize that you guys have been moving to quicker more interactive games, cutting the game time averages by a significant amount, adding snowball mechanics to make it harder to come back from a game, and increasing mana, and cooldown reduction accessibility.

However lately, it seems like you guys have been moving back to a slower gameplay and removing snowball mechanics, I was wondering if you could expand on the current vision of the game?

What are you guys trying to achieve on the big scope of things?

Additionally, with the incremental buffs to duelists, divers, and assassins (The upcoming Sterak's Gage, granting bonus AD buffs all AD assassins and divers unless they bought Trinity Force, Spear of Shojin, and Atma's Reckoning), I am afraid this will increase the amount of games that are dictated by a "raid-boss" type player dominating the entire map. And with the current state of critical damage (not chance, but the amount of damage Marksmen deal) Marksmen will not have enough damage to kill a duelist before getting dove and killed themselves. 

So by making games shorter, and delaying Crit based power spikes, Marksmen will not be able to complete their core items, fulfill their power fantasy, and perform their intended role of dealing the most damage per second. This leads me to the following question, what is the current role of crit-based marksmen? How do they fit into a team composition? And how will they be able to complete their items before the game ends at 22 mins. 

To wrap it up, I suspect these might be all interconnected, is your vision of the game a more "fighter style" game? Since crit marksmen don't have any flashy abilities or amazing outplay potential besides kiting and right clicking, you are nerfing them to make space for more interactive marksmen, like Lucian. While at the same time nerfing tanks with huge amounts of true damage, since tanks don't have flashy kits either, and buffing duelists to encourage fights in the top lane. 

I really appreciate you taking your time to write this! And good luck on the rift.
